messages.message:
*[Action Required: Python 3.9 Upgrade]* 

The time has come to start upgrading our services to Python 3.9. We will be merging in the first migration, which updates `api-server` to run with Python 3.9.15, later today. To prepare your local dev environment, if you run Python services locally, please perform the steps described here at your earliest convenience: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/33997. (You should be able to perform these steps in the background while doing other work on your own branch)

If you hit any snags, first check the “Common Problems” section of the PR. If your issue isn’t covered, reply here in a thread and I can help debug. Thank you all!
this is required even if you run Python services through Docker locally, right? because you probably still need to run `make test` locally at some point?
this is not required for running a service in docker, but it is necessary for “make test” to work
however i will add — even if you only run services in docker, you’ll still need poetry to add/update dependency versions of a service that is migrated to use poetry
